juzs.text: And those who don’t expect a meeting with Us (who deny the Day of Resurrection), say: “Why are not the angels sent down to us, or why do we not see our Lord?” Indeed they think arrogantly of themselves and are scornful with great pride
On the Day they will see the angels; no glad tidings will be for the criminals that Day. Angels will say: “(All glad tidings) are strictly forbidden (for you).”
And We shall turn to whatever deeds they (disbelievers) did, and We shall make them (deeds) as scattered floating particles of dust for them
The residents of Paradise on that Day will have the best abode and the finest place to relax
And (remember) the Day when the heaven shall be rent asunder with clouds, and the angels will be sent down with a grand descending
The sovereignty on that Day will be the true (sovereignty), belongs to the Gracious (Allah), and it will be a hard Day for the disbelievers
(Remember) the Day when the wrongdoer will bite on his hands saying: “Oh! Would that I had taken a way with the Messenger (Muhammad)
Oh! Woe to me! Would that I had never taken so-and-so as a friend
Indeed they led me astray from the reminder (this Qur’an) after when it had come to me.” Satan is ever a deserter to human in the Hour of need
And the Messenger (Muhammad) will say: “O my Lord! Surely, my people took this Qur’an as deserted (neither learned nor acted upon it).”
Thus We have made for every Prophet an enemy among the criminals. But your Lord is sufficient as a Guide and Helper

And those who disbelieve say: “Why is not the Qur’an revealed to him all at once?” Thus (it was sent down in parts) so that We may strengthen your hearts thereby. And We have revealed it to you (gradually in stages). (It was revealed to Muhammad in 23 years)
And they don’t bring to you example (to oppose or find fault in you or in this Qur’an), but We reveal to you the truth, and better explanation
Those who will be gathered on their faces to hell, they will be in an evil state, for they had lost the Right Way
And indeed We gave Moses the Scripture (the Torah), and placed his brother Aaron with him as a helper
and We said: “Go you both to the people who have denied Our Verses.” Then We destroyed them with complete destruction
And the people of Noah, when they denied the Messengers, We drowned them, and We made them an example for mankind. And We have prepared a painful punishment for the wrongdoers
And (also) Ad and Thamud, and the residents of Ar-Rass, and many generations in between (were destroyed)
And for each of them, We have put forward examples, and each of them We have brought to ruin destruction

And indeed they (disbelievers) have passed by the town (of Prophet Lot) on which the evil rain was rained. Did they not see it (with their own eyes)? But they were not used to expect (believed) any Resurrection
And when they see you (O Muhammad), they treat you not but in mockery (saying): “Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a Messenger

He (Muhammad) would have nearly misled us from our deities, had it not been that we were patient and constant in our (worship)!” They will know when they see the punishment; they will realize who actually is most astray from the Right Way
Have you (O Muhammad) seen him taken his own desire as worthy of worship? Would you then be a Guide to him
Or do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are nothing but like cattle; nay they are even farther astray from the way
Have you not seen how your Lord spread the shadow? If He willed, He could have made it still. Then We have made the sun a guide over it
then We withdraw it to Us with a gradual withdrawal
And it is He Who makes the night a covering for you, and the sleep as rest, and makes the day to get up
And it is He Who sends the winds as heralds of glad tidings before His Mercy, and We send down pure water (rain) from the sky
so that We may give life thereby to a dead land, and We give to drink thereof many cattle and men that We have created
And indeed We have distributed it (water) amongst them in order that they may remember (the Grace of Allah), yet most people refuse except disbelief (ingratitude)
And had We willed, We could have raised a Warner in every town
so don’t obey the disbelievers, but strive against them with it (the Qur’an), with utmost endeavor
And it is He Who has let the 2 seas merge, one palatable and sweet, and the other salt and bitter; and He has set a barrier and a suppressed partition between them
And it is He Who has created human from water, and has appointed for them blood relationships and marriage relationships. And your Lord is All-Powerful
And yet they (disbelievers) worship besides Allah which can neither benefit them nor harm them, and the disbelievers are helpers (of the Satan) against their Lord
And We have not sent you (O Muhammad) but as a bearer of glad tidings and a Warner
Say: “I don’t ask you any reward for this (that I have brought the Qur’an from my Lord and its preaching, etc) except that whoever wills, may take a way to his Lord.”
And put your trust (O Muhammad) in the Ever-Living (Allah) who does not die, glorify His Praises, and He alone is the All-Knower of the sins of His servants

Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in 6 days. Then He rose over the Throne (that suits His Majesty). The Gracious! Ask Him (O Muhammad), as He is All-Knower of everything

And when it is said to them: “Prostrate yourself to the Gracious (Allah),” they ask: “What is the Gracious? Shall we fall down in prostration because you (O Muhammad) command us?" It increases dislike in them
Blessed is He Who has placed big stars in the sky, has placed therein a great lamp (sun) and a moon giving light
And it is He Who has put the night and the day in succession, for those who desire to remember or desire to show their gratitude
And the servants of the Gracious (Allah) are those who walk on the earth in humility, and when the foolish address them, they say: “peace,”
and those who spend the night before their Lord, prostrating and standing
and those who say: “Our Lord! Avert from us the punishment of hell. Surely! Its punishment is an inseparable, permanent punishment
indeed it (hell) is evil as an abode and as a place to reside,”
and those who, when they spend, neither are extravagant nor stingy, but there is a medium (way) between those (extremes)

and those who neither invoke with Allah another one worthy of worship, nor kill the soul which Allah has forbidden, except for just cause, nor commit illegal sexual intercourse. Those who do this shall receive the punishment
the punishment will be doubled for them (on the) Day of Resurrection, and they will abide in it in disgrace
except those who repent, believe, and do righteous deeds; for them Allah will change their sins into good deeds, and Allah is Forgiving, Merciful
And those who repent and do righteous deeds, then surely they repent to Allah (with true) repentance
And those who don’t bear witness to falsehood, and if they pass by some evil play or evil talk, they pass by with dignity
And those who, when they are reminded of the Verses of their Lord, they don’t fall deaf and blind upon them
And those who say: “Our Lord! Bestow on us from our wives and our offspring comfort of our eyes, and make us leaders for the pious.”
Those will be rewarded with the highest place (in Paradise) because they kept patience. They shall meet with greetings in it and the word of peace
(They shall) abide therein; excellent it is as an abode, and as a place to reside
Say (O Muhammad to the disbelievers): “My Lord pays no attention to you except for your invocation (to Him). But indeed you have denied (Him), so the punishment will be necessary.”
Ta-Seen-Mim
These are the Verses of the clear book (the Qur’an)
It may be that you (O Muhammad) are going to kill yourself (with grief) because they don’t become believers
If We will, We could send down a Verse to them from the heaven so their necks would bend to it in humility
And never comes to them any reminder from the Gracious (Allah) as a recent revelation, but they have been turning away from it
So they have denied (this Qur’an), then the news will come to them of what they were mocking at
Don’t they observe the earth to see how much We have caused every good kind to grow in it
Surely, in this is a Sign, yet most of them are not believers
And surely, your Lord! He is truly the All-Mighty, the Merciful
And (remember) when your Lord called Moses (saying): “You go to the people who are wrongdoers
the people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear Allah?”
He said: “My Lord! Surely, I fear that they will deny me
and my breast straitens, and my tongue does not express well. So send Aaron
And they have a charge of crime (man-slaughter) against me, and I fear they will kill me.”
(Allah) said: “Nay! Go you both with Our Signs. Surely! We shall be with you, listening
And go to Pharaoh both of you and say: We are the Messengers of the Lord of the worlds
So (send to go) with us the children of Israel.”
(Pharaoh) said (to Moses): “Did we not bring you up among us as a child? You stayed with us many years of your life
And you did what you did (crime of killing a man). You are one of the ungrateful.”
Moses said: “I did it then when I was from the misguided
So I fled from you when I feared you. But my Lord has granted me right judgment, and made me one of the Messengers
And this is a favor with which you admonish me, that you have enslaved the children of Israel.”
Pharaoh said: “And who is the Lord of the worlds?”
(Moses) said: “Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, if you are seeking to be convinced with certainty.”
(Pharaoh) said to those around him: “Don’t you hear (what he says)?”
(Moses) said: “(Allah is) your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers!”
(Pharaoh) said: “Surely, your Messenger who has been sent to you is a madman!”
(Moses) said: “Lord of the east and the west, and all that is between them, if you did but understand!”
(Pharaoh) said: “If you choose one worthy of worship other than me, I will certainly put you among the prisoners.”
(Moses) said: “Even if I bring you something clear?”
(Pharaoh) said: “Bring it forth, if you are from the truthful!”
So (Moses) threw his stick, and behold, it was a clear serpent
And then he drew out his hand, and behold, it became white (bright) to all beholders
(Pharaoh) said to the chiefs around him: “Surely! This is indeed a well-Versed sorcerer
he wants to drive you out of your land by his sorcery. Now what is it that you advice?”
They said: “Put him off and his brother (for a while), and send callers to the cities
they will bring to you every well-Versed sorcerer.”
So the sorcerers were assembled at a fixed time on an appointed Day
And it was said to the people: “Will you assemble
So that we may follow the sorcerers if they are the winners.”
When the sorcerers arrived, they said to Pharaoh: “Is there a reward for us if we are the winners?”
(Pharaoh) said: “Yes, and surely then you will be of those brought near (to me).”
Moses said to them: “Throw what you are going to throw!”
So they threw their ropes and their sticks, and said: “By the might of Pharaoh, it is we who will be the winners!”
Then Moses threw his stick, and behold, it swallowed up all that they falsely showed
And the sorcerers fell down prostrate
saying: “We believe in the Lord of the worlds
the Lord of Moses and Aaron.”

(Pharaoh) said: “You have believed in him before I give permission to you. Surely, he is your chief who has taught you magic! So surely, you shall come to know. I will cut off your hands and your legs on opposite sides, and I will crucify you all.”
They said: “No harm (don’t care)! Surely, we are going to return to our Lord (anyway)
Surely! We hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, as we are the first of the believers (in Moses).”
And We revealed to Moses saying: “Depart by night with My servants, surely, you will be pursued.”
Then Pharaoh sent callers to the cities
(saying): “Surely! These are (indeed but) a small band
and surely, they have enraged us
and surely we are all assembled, well prepared.”
So, We made them leave from their gardens, water springs
treasures, and honorable places
Thus We caused the children of Israel to inherit such things
So they (people of Pharaoh) pursued them at sunrise
And when the 2 hosts saw (each other), the companions of Moses said: “Surely we are to be overtaken.”
(Moses) said: “Nay, surely! With me is my Lord, He will guide me.”
Then We revealed to Moses (saying): “Strike the sea with your stick.” It parted, and each part (of the sea water) became like the huge mountain
Then We brought near (to that sea) the others (Pharaoh and his army)
and We saved Moses and all those with him
then We drowned the others
Surely! In this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers
and surely, your Lord! He is truly the All-Mighty, the Merciful
And recite to them the story of Abraham
when he (Abraham) said his father and his people: “What do you worship?”
They said: “We worship idols, and we remain devoted to them.”
He said: “Do they hear you when you call (on them)
Or do they benefit you or do they harm you?”
They said: “Nay, but we found our forefathers doing so.”
He said: “Do you observe which you have been worshipping
you and your forefathers
Surely! They are enemies to me, except the Lord of the worlds
who has created me, and it is He who guides me
And it is He Who feeds me and gives me to drink
and when I am ill, it is He Who cures me
Who will cause me to die, then will bring me to life (again)
and Who, I hope, will forgive me my faults on the Day of Recompense.”
(Abraham prayed): “My Lord! Bestow wisdom on me, join me with the righteous
and grant me an honorable mention in later generations
and make me one of the inheritors of the Paradise of Delight
and forgive my father, surely he is of the erring
and don’t disgrace me on the Day when all creatures will be resurrected
the Day when neither wealth nor sons will avail
except the one who will bring a clean heart to Allah
and Paradise will be brought near to the pious
and the hellfire will be placed in full view for the erring
and it will be said to them: “Where are those (false deities) that you used to worship
instead of Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?”
Then they will be thrown on their faces into it (fire), they are those who were in error
and the hosts (soldiers) of Satan together
they will say while they argue in it
(saying): “by Allah, we were truly in a clear error
when We held you (false deities) as equals (in worship) with the Lord of the worlds
And none has brought us into error except the criminals
Now we have no intercessors
nor a close friend (to help us)
If we had a chance (to return to the world), we would be among the believers!”
Surely! In this narration there is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers
And surely, your Lord, He is truly the All-Mighty, the Merciful
The people of Noah denied the Messengers
When their brother Noah said to them: “Will you not fear Allah
Surely I am a trustworthy Messenger to you
so fear Allah, and obey me
I don’t ask you any reward for it (my message), my reward is not but from the Lord of the worlds
so fear Allah and obey me.”
They said: “Shall we believe in you, when the lowest (of the people) follow you?”
He said: “And what knowledge have I of what they used to do
Their account is with my Lord, if you could know
And I am not going to drive away the believers
I am not but a plain Warner.”
They said: “If you don’t cease, O Noah! You will surely be among those stoned (to death).”
He said: “My Lord! Surely, my people have denied me
Therefore judge between me and them with fair judgment, and save me and those of the believers who are with me.”
And We saved him and those with him in the laden ship
then We drowned the rest (disbelievers) thereafter
Surely, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers
And surely! Your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Merciful
Ad (people) denied the Messengers
When their brother Hud said to them: “Will you not fear Allah
Surely! I am a trustworthy Messenger to you
So fear Allah, and obey me
I don’t ask you any reward for it, my reward is from the Lord of the worlds
Do you build landmark on every high palace to play for fun
And do you take for yourselves palaces (fine buildings) as if you will reside therein forever
And when you seize anyone, you seize him as tyrants
So fear Allah, and obey me
And Fear Him Who has aided you with all (good things) that you know
He has aided you with cattle, children
and gardens, and springs
Surely, I fear for you the punishment of a Great Day.”
They said: “It is the same to us whether you preach or you are not of those who preach
This is nothing but the customs of the ancients
And we are not going to be punished.”
So they denied him, and We destroyed them. Surely! In this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers
And surely! Your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Merciful
Thamud (people) denied the Messengers
When their brother Saleh said to them: “Will you not fear Allah
Surely I am a trustworthy Messenger to you
So fear Allah, and obey me
I don’t ask any reward for it (my message); my reward is from the Lord of the worlds
Will you be left secure in that which you have here (forever)
In gardens, springs
and cornfields, and date-palms with its soft flowering branches
and you carve houses in the mountains skillfully
So fear Allah, and obey me
And don’t follow the command of the wasters
who make mischief in the land, and don’t reform.”
They said: “Surely you are only of those bewitched
You are not but a human being like us. Then bring us a sign if you are of the truthful.”
He (Saleh) said: “This is a she-camel (Allah sent as you asked); it has a right to drink water and you have a right to drink water on a known day
And don’t touch her with harm, lest the punishment of a great Day may seize you.”
But they killed her, and then they became regretful
so the punishment overtook them. Surely, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers
And surely! Your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Merciful
The people of Lot denied the Messengers
When their brother Lot said to them: “Will you not fear Allah
Surely! I am a trustworthy Messenger to you
So fear Allah, and obey me
I don’t ask of you any reward for it (my message), my reward is from the Lord of the worlds
And will you go into the males (to fornicate) of the mankind
and leave those whom Allah has created for you to be your wives? Nay, you are a transgressing people!”
They said: “If you don’t cease, O Lot! Surely, you will be one of those who are expelled!”
He said: “I am, indeed of those who disapprove with severe anger and fury
My Lord! Save me and my family from what they do.”
So We saved him and all his family
except an old woman (his wife) among those who remained behind
Then afterward We destroyed the others
And We rained on them a rain (of punishment). Evil was the rain which fell on those who had been warned
Surely, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers
And surely! Your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Merciful
The residents of Al-Aiyka (a garden with thick trees near Midian) denied the Messengers
When Shuaib said to them: “Will you not fear Allah
I am a trustworthy Messenger to you
So fear Allah, and obey me
I don’t ask of you any reward for it (my message), my reward is from the Lord of the worlds
Give full measure, and don’t be among those who cause loss (to others by fraud)
And weigh with the just straight balance
and neither defraud people by reducing their things, nor do evil in the land making corruption
And fear Him Who created you and the generations before you.”
They said: “Surely you are one of those bewitched
You are not but a human being like us and surely, we think that indeed you are one of the liars
So cause a piece of the heaven to fall on us, if you are of the truthful!”
He said: “My Lord is Best Knower of what you do.”
But they denied him, so the punishment of the Day of shadow (cloud carrying Allah’s punishment) seized them, indeed that was the punishment of a great Day
Surely, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers
And surely! Your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Merciful
And truly, this (the Qur’an) is a revelation of the Lord of the worlds
The trustworthy spirit (Gabriel) has brought down
upon your heart (O Muhammad) so that you may be one of the warners
in the plain Arabic language
And surely, it (the Qur’an) has the Scriptures of former people
Is it not a sign to them that the learned scholars knew it of the children of Israel
And if We had revealed it (this Qur’an) to any of the non-Arabs
and who had recited it (in Arabic) to them, they would still not have believed in it
We have caused it (disbelief) to enter in the hearts of the criminals
They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment
it will come to them suddenly while they don’t perceive it
Then they will say: “Can we be given respite?”
Do they wish to hasten on Our Punishment
Have you thought if We do let them enjoy for years
and afterwards comes to them what (punishment) they are promised
all that which their past enjoyment be to them
And We never destroyed a township without sending its warners
by way of reminder (in advance), and We have never been unjust
And it is not the devils who have brought it (this Qur’an) down
neither it would suit them, nor they can produce it
Surely, they have been removed far from hearing it
So don’t invoke with Allah another one worthy of worship lest you be among those who receive punishment
And warn your tribe (O Muhammad) of near relatives
and lower or put down your wing (be kind and humble) to those of the believers who follow you
if they disobey you, say: “Verily, I am not responsible for what you do.”
And put your trust in the Mighty, the Merciful
Who sees you (O Muhammad) when you stand up (at night in prayers)
and see your movements among those who fall prostrate
Surely! He is the All-Hearer, the All-Knower
Shall I inform you (O people!) upon whom the devils descend
They descend on every liar, sinner
who gives ear (to the devils), most of them are liars
as for the poets, the erring ones follow them
Don’t you see how aimlessly they wander in every valley
and say what they don’t do
Except those who believe, do righteous deeds, remember Allah much, and vindicate themselves after they have wronged. Those who do wrong (will know) what overturning they will be overturned
Ta-Seen. These are Verses of the Qur’an, a clear book
a guide, and glad tidings for the believers
those who establish the prayer, give the obligatory charity, and believe with certainty in the Hereafter
Surely, those who don’t believe in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds seem fair to them, so that they wander about blindly
They are those for them there will be an evil punishment (in this world). They will be the greatest losers in the Hereafter
And surely, you (O Muhammad) are being taught the Qur’an from the One Who is All-Wise, All-Knower
(Remember) when Moses said to his family: “Surely! I have seen a fire, I will bring you some information from it, or I will bring you a burning brand so that you may warm yourselves.”
But when he came to it, he was called (by a voice) that: “Blessed is (Allah) Who is in the fire, and whoever is around it! And glory be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds
O Moses! Surely! It is I, Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise

Throw down your stick!” But when he saw it moving as if it were a snake, he turned in flight, and did not even look back. (It was said): “O Moses! Don’t fear, surely! The Messengers don’t fear in front of Me
except the one who has done wrong and afterwards even if he changes evil for good, then surely, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

And now put your hand into your bosom, it will come out (shining) white without any harm. These are among the 9 Verses (you will take) to Pharaoh and his people, and surely, they are not pious people.”
But when Our Verses came to them, clear to see, they said: “This is a clear magic.”
They rejected them (Verses) wrongfully and arrogantly, though their own selves were convinced of them. So see how was the end of the evil-doers
And indeed We gave knowledge to David and Solomon, and they said: “All the praises are to Allah, Who has preferred us above many of His believing servants!”

Solomon inherited (the knowledge of) David. He said: “O mankind! We have been taught the language of birds and on us has been bestowed from every thing. Surely, this indeed is grace evident (from Allah).”
And Solomon gathered his hosts of jinns, people, birds, and they were set in battle order
till, when they came to the valley of the ants, one ant said: “O ants! Enter your residences, lest Solomon and his hosts crush you (by their feet) while they don’t perceive.”

So he (Solomon) smiled laughing at its speech and said: “My Lord! Bestow upon me power that I may thank You for Favors, which You have bestowed on me and on my parents, so that I may do righteous deeds that will please You, and admit me by Your Mercy among Your righteous servants.”
He inspected the birds, and said: “What is the matter that I don’t see the hoopoe (old world bird) or is he among the absentees
I will surely punish him with severe punishment, or slaughter him, unless he brings me a clear reason (for absence).”
But he (the hoopoe) did not stay long, he (came up and) said: “I have just found (the knowledge of a thing) which you have not found. I have come to you from Sheba with true news
Surely I found a woman ruling over them, and she has been given from every thing, and she has a great throne
I found her and her people prostrating themselves before the sun instead of Allah, Satan has made their deeds seem fair to them, and has barred them from (Allah’s) Way, so they are not guided
they don’t prostrate themselves before Allah, Who brings out the hidden thing in the heavens and the earth, and knows what you conceal and what you reveal
Allah, there is no one worthy of worship but He, the Lord of the Supreme Throne!”
(Solomon) said: “We shall see whether you speak the truth or you are of the liars
Go with this letter of mine, and deliver it to them, then bring back from them, and see what answer they return.”
She (the queen) said: “O chiefs! Surely! A noble letter has been delivered to me
surely it is from Solomon, and surely it reads: In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful
(It reads) Don’t be exalted against me, but come to me as Muslims.”
She said: "O chiefs! Advise me in my case. I don’t decide any case till you are present.”
They said: “We have power and great strength, and the matter is for you to command; so think what you will command.”
She said: “Surely! When the kings enter a town, they spoil it, and make the most honorable of its people the lowest. And thus they always do
But surely I will send them a present, and see with what answer the Messengers return.”

So when (the envoys of the Queen with the present) came to Solomon, he said: “Will you help me in wealth? What Allah has given me is better than that which He has given you! Nay, you rejoice in your gift

(Solomon said to the chief of her messengers who brought the present): Go back to them (your people). (If your people don’t submit) surely we shall come to them with army which they will never be able to resist, we shall drive them out from there (land) in disgrace, and they will be humiliated.”
(When Solomon heard that the Queen of Sheba was coming in submission) he said: “O chiefs! Which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me as Muslims?”
A strong one from the jinns said: “I will bring it to you before you rise from your place (council). Surely, I am indeed strong, trustworthy for such work.”

One with whom was the knowledge of the Scripture said: “I will bring it to you before your eyesight returns to you (within twinkling of an eye)!” Then when he (Solomon) saw it placed before him, he said: “This is from the Grace of my Lord to test me whether I am grateful or ungrateful! Whoever is grateful, indeed is grateful for oneself, and whoever is ungrateful (should know that) certainly, my Lord is Rich, Bountiful.”
Then he said: “Disguise for her throne so that we may see whether she will be guided (able to recognize her throne), or she will be of those who are not guided.”

So when she came, it was said (to her): “Is your throne like this?” She said: “(It is) as though it were the same. Knowledge was bestowed on us in advance of this, and we have become Muslims (submitted to Allah).”
Other deities which she used to worship besides Allah has prevented her (from Islam), indeed she was of a disbelieving people

It was said to her: “Enter the palace.” (The floor was glass surface with water underneath it). But when she saw it, she thought it was a pool, and she (pulled up her clothes) uncovering her legs. Solomon said: “Surely, it is a palace (with a glass surface and water underneath it) traced smooth with glass.” She said: “My Lord! Surely, I have wronged myself, and I submit (accept Islam) with Solomon to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.”
And indeed We sent to Thamud their brother Saleh, saying: “Worship Allah.” Then look! They became 2 parties (believers and disbelievers) quarreling with each other
He said: “O my people! Why do you seek to hasten the evil (Allah’s punishment) before the good (Allah’s Mercy)? Why don’t you seek the forgiveness of Allah, so that you may be treated with mercy?”
They said: “We consider bad luck from you and those with you.” He said: “Your luck is with Allah; in fact, you are a people that are being tested.”
There were in the city 9 men (leaders) who made mischief in the land, and they would not reform

They said: “Swear one to another by Allah so that we shall surely make a night attack on him and his family, and afterwards we will surely say to his near relatives: we did not witness the destruction of his family, and surely! We are truthful.”
So they plotted a plot, and We planned a plan, while they did not perceive
Thus see how the end of their plot was! Surely! We destroyed them and their nation, all together
These are their houses in ruin, for what they did wrong. Surely, in this is indeed a sign for people who know
And We saved those who believed, and used to fear Allah
And (remember) Lot! When he said to his people: “Do you commit indecency while you see
Why do you come to men with lust instead of women? Nay, but you are a people who are ignorant.”
